intro: Brachystegia holtzii, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by flat, pod-like fruits. It typically grows in open woodlands and is adapted to seasonal climates with distinct dry and wet periods. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
